movies.title: Partizanska eskadrila
movies.plot: An epic film of all time. It is one of the greatest spectacle that was filmed in Yugoslavia in the 20th century. In the spring of 1942, the German air force had complete dominance, not only in the sky of Yugoslavia, but also almost the whole of Europe. Partisans in Yugoslavia at that time had planes that are like other weapons snatched from the enemy. During the ''Third Offensive'', 1942, on planes of different types abducted by the enemy, these are people took unequal air battle, specifying the enemy blows where he thought he was invulnerable, thereby contributing to the final victory. This is a film about the creation of partisan aviation and its early struggles. The film was directed by Hajrudin Krvavac, a famous director of films of this type (Walter Defends Sarajevo, Bridge and Diverzanti), while starring the then very popular Yugoslav actors, often in just these films, Velimir 'Bata, Ljubisa Samardzic, Bekim Fehmiu, Faruk Begoli.
movies.simplePlot: The first Yugoslav Partisan air force unit. Loosely based on historical facts.

biography.bio: Bekim Fehmiu was born on June 1, 1936 in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for I Even Met Happy Gypsies (1967), Black Sunday (1977) and Special Education (1977). He was married to Branka Petric. He died on June 15, 2010 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Bekim Fehmiu

biography.bio: Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic was born on June 5, 1933 in Koracica near Mladenovac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Srecni ljudi (1993), Ice (2012) and Joli village, jolie flamme (1996). He was married to Julijana 'Lula' Zivojinovic. He died on May 22, 2016 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic

biography.bio: Ljubisa Samardzic was born into a miner's family. His acting talent was discovered very early and he won a scholarship with respected director Bojan Stupica. After graduating Belgrade Drama Arts Academy and playing a few theater roles, Ljubisa Samardzic was given the part in Igre na skelama (1961). After that experience, he decided to quit theater and try his luck in movies. In a few years he got the leading roles in some of the most popular or influential movies ever made in former Yugoslavia and soon became one of the movie icons in that country, together with 'Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic', Milena Dravic and Boris Dvornik. In the 1980s and during the break-up of Yugoslavia his acting star began to fade but he managed to switch careers by founding his own movie production company together with his son Dragan Samardzic. The company not only survived the harsh times of UN sanctions against rump Yugoslavia, but managed to produce few successful movies that became popular in many of the former Yugoslav republics. Ljubisa Samardzic now lives and works in Belgrade, is married and has two children and two grandchildren.
biography.name: Ljubisa Samardzic

biography.bio: Rados Bajic was born on September 24, 1953 in Medvedja, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor and writer, known for Selo gori, a baba se ceslja (2007), Double Trouble (2016) and Selo gori... i tako (2009).
biography.name: Rados Bajic

biography.bio: Radko Polic was born on August 18, 1942 in Crnomelj, Slovenia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Idealist (1976), Night Boats (2012) and Balkan ekspres (1983). He is married to Barbara Levstik. He was previously married to Rozalija Hace and Milena Zupancic.
biography.name: Radko Polic

biography.bio: Branko Plesa was born on March 6, 1926 in Kiseljak, Bosnia and Hercegovina, Yugoslavia. He was an actor and director, known for Gore dole (1996), Lilika (1970) and SS Strike at Dawn (1958). He died on June 9, 2001 in Belgrade, Serbia, Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
biography.name: Branko Plesa

biography.bio: Faruk Begolli was the most famous Kosovo Albanian actor and director in Yugoslavia (along with Bekim Fehmiu). He attended high school in Pristina and completed the academy of film in Belgrade (1966). Begolli played in more than 60 films, starting with Veljko Bulajic's Pogled u zenicu Sunca (1966). He cooperated with director Purisa Dordevic in his films Podne (Noon), Jutro (The Morning), and San (The Dream), and his notable roles include Bitka na Neretvi, Cuvar plaze u zimskom periodu and Dervis i Smrt (The Dervish and Death). In the late 1980s, Begolli returned from Belgrade to Kosovo, where he worked at the University of Pristina as a professor at the Faculty of Drama. His last lead role was in Ekrem Kryeziu's Dashuria e Bjeshkeve te Nemuna (Love in the Damned Mountain), and his last piece was Etjet e Kosoves (Kosovo: Desperate Search), where he was also a co-scenarist. He died in 2007, after a long battle with cancer.
biography.name: Faruk Begolli

biography.bio: Branko Djuric was born on October 4, 1949 in Sabac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Ljubav i mrznja (2007), Pod istragom (1977) and The Professional (2003). He is married to Andrijana Videnovic. They have one child.
biography.name: Branko Djuric

biography.bio: Jordanco Cevrevski was born on May 17, 1951 in Skoplje, Macedonia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor and producer, known for Mirage (2004), Hi-Fi (1987) and Piknik u Topoli (1981).
biography.name: Jordanco Cevrevski

biography.bio: Zlata Petkovic was born on February 11, 1954 in Svrljig, Serbia, Yugoslavia. She was an actress, known for The Written Off Return (1976), Povratak otpisanih (1976) and The Bug Killer (1971). She was married to Aleksandar Sanja Ilic. She died on December 3, 2012 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Zlata Petkovic

biography.bio: Suada Ahmetasevic is an actress, known for Strijelac (1998), Go West (2005) and Ritam zivota (2007).
biography.name: Suada Ahmetasevic

biography.bio: Aljosa Vuckovic was born on December 17, 1946 in Buzet, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Jelena (2004), Zauvijek mlad (2009) and Bolji zivot (1987).
biography.name: Aljosa Vuckovic

biography.bio: Ljuba Tadic was born on May 31, 1929 in Urosevac, Serbia, Yugoslavia as Ljubivoje Tadic. He was an actor and writer, known for La cinquième offensive (1973), Traitement spécial (1980) and Mars na Drinu (1964). He was married to Visnja Djordjevic. He died on October 28, 2005 in Belgrade, Serbia and Montenegro.
biography.name: Ljuba Tadic

biography.bio: Peter Carsten was born on April 30, 1928 in Weißenburg, Bavaria, Germany as Peter Ramsentaler. He was an actor and producer, known for Dark of the Sun (1968), The Quiller Memorandum (1966) and Stalingrad: Dogs, Do You Want to Live Forever? (1959). He was married to Lilijana and Divna. He died on April 20, 2012 in Lucija, Slovenia.
biography.name: Peter Carsten

biography.bio: Dragomir Felba was born on July 7, 1921 in Skoplje, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Kapò (1960), Suncokreti (1988) and Mahovina na asfaltu (1983). He died on July 13, 2006 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Dragomir Felba

filmingLocations.location: Airport Zeljava, Mountain Pljesavica, Croatian-Bosnian border, Yugoslavia
